description: From Middle English beestly, bestely, beastelich, equivalent to beast +‎ -ly. Compare West Frisian bistachtich (“beastly”), Dutch beestachtig (“beastly”), German biestig (“beastly”).

adjectives.description: beastly (comparative beastlier or more beastly, superlative beastliest or most beastly)

entries.meaning: (UK) Pertaining to, or having the form, nature, or habits of, a beast.
(UK) Similar to the nature of a beast; contrary to the nature and dignity of human beings.

examples: Stop being so beastly to her!

entries.meaning: (of computing hardware) Powerful, having a powerful appearance
examples: In addition to a Core i7-860 with a full-sized heatsink and 4GB of DDR3 RAM, the company showed its SUGO SG07 housing today's most beastly graphics card, the dual-GPU Radeon HD 5970, which is about 30cm long.

adverbs.description: beastly (comparative more beastly, superlative most beastly)

examples: They have insulted me most beastly. Moreover, they are, everyone of them, black-satan filthmen.
